intro: Eleocharis tuvinica, commonly known as Tuvinian spike-rush, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its dense, spike-like inflorescences and narrow, grass-like leaves. This plant typically grows in wetland environments, such as marshes and along the edges of water bodies. Eleocharis tuvinica is often found in temperate regions and is adapted to moist, nutrient-poor soils. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
